meanings.definition: To educate or train again, especially in a different way or setting.
meanings.sent1: She decided to reschool herself in painting by taking art classes.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to reschool the students on proper lab safety procedures.
meanings.sent3: After forgetting how to ride a bike, he had to reschool himself on balancing.
meanings.sent4: The coach reschools the team on the fundamentals of the game before every match.
meanings.sent5: The online course offers a chance to reschool in digital marketing strategies.

meanings.definition: The act of providing education or training again, often in a different manner.
meanings.sent1: The reschooling of employees is essential for keeping up with industry changes.
meanings.sent2: The reschooling program offers workshops on new teaching techniques.
meanings.sent3: The reschooling event turned learning into a fun and engaging experience.
meanings.sent4: Her reschooling in coding opened up new career opportunities for her.
meanings.sent5: The reschooling initiative aims to improve skills in a variety of fields.

meanings.definition: The process of reintroducing someone to a school environment after a period of absence.
meanings.sent1: The reschooling of the student after a long illness was smooth and supportive.
meanings.sent2: Reschooling after a long break can be challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent3: The reschooling process involved meeting new classmates and teachers.
meanings.sent4: Her reschooling experience brought back memories of her school days.
meanings.sent5: The reschooling transition was made easier with the help of a guidance counselor.
